medical_history.chief_complaint: 24 hours of epigastric abdominal dull discomfort localized to the right lower quadrant
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 24 hours prior to presentation, starting as epigastric dull discomfort which later localized to the right lower quadrant. Associated symptoms include anorexia, nausea, and chills. The patient denies vomiting, diarrhea, and fevers.
